unparsed_output: According to the article, four reoperations, four of which were performed because of wear of the polyethylene insert. In addition, one hinge cemented femoral component was revised at fifteen years. The survival rate with unicompartmental replacement of a list for any indication was 92.6% at fifteen years. The mean Knee Society score and functional score at fifteen years were 96 and 78 points, respectively. The prevalence of radiolucenct lines was 13%, with 2% around the tibial and some around the patella. None of these lines were clinically relevant. There was no evidence of progressive radiolucenct lines, and there was one case of asymmetric femoral osthothisis.
